article.title: Studying the ICM in clusters of galaxies via surface brightness fluctuations of the cosmic X-ray background

multiple_choice_question.text:
What does the default mosaic mask in Figure 1 primarily aim to achieve?

(A) Identify areas of high exposure time for further analysis.
(B) Highlight regions dominated by the instrumental background.
(C) Remove resolved point and extended sources from the flux mosaic.
(D) Emphasize the location of prominent clusters of galaxies.
choices: Identify areas of high exposure time for further analysis.
Highlight regions dominated by the instrumental background.
Remove resolved point and extended sources from the flux mosaic.
Emphasize the location of prominent clusters of galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text:
How does the special mosaic mask in Figure 2 differ from the default mask?

(A) It includes all resolved sources, both point-like and extended.
(B) It retains resolved extended sources while masking point sources.
(C) It focuses on a smaller region within the XBOOTES field.
(D) It utilizes a different energy band for source detection.
choices: It includes all resolved sources, both point-like and extended.
It retains resolved extended sources while masking point sources.
It focuses on a smaller region within the XBOOTES field.
It utilizes a different energy band for source detection.

multiple_choice_question.text:
What does the blue curve in Figure 3 represent?

(A) The power spectrum of resolved clusters of galaxies.
(B) The photon shot noise contribution to the power spectrum.
(C) The point-source shot noise multiplied by the PSF-smearing model.
(D) The LSS power spectrum of the unresolved CXB.
choices: The power spectrum of resolved clusters of galaxies.
The photon shot noise contribution to the power spectrum.
The point-source shot noise multiplied by the PSF-smearing model.
The LSS power spectrum of the unresolved CXB.

multiple_choice_question.text:
What does the red triangle in Figure 11 represent?

(A) The best-fit value for the observed energy spectrum of resolved clusters of galaxies.
(B) The expected flux-weighted mean temperature and redshift of resolved clusters.
(C) The best-fit value for the simulated energy spectrum of unresolved clusters of galaxies.
(D) The median temperature and redshift of resolved clusters of galaxies.
choices: The best-fit value for the observed energy spectrum of resolved clusters of galaxies.
The expected flux-weighted mean temperature and redshift of resolved clusters.
The best-fit value for the simulated energy spectrum of unresolved clusters of galaxies.
The median temperature and redshift of resolved clusters of galaxies.
